dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c Roach b Brathwaite 120 (125b 14x4 1x6 179m) SR: 96

dismissalComment.html: it's a skyer and Roach makes no mistake at long off. The fielder went deep just before this delivery. Slower ball, not full enough, and Kohli tries to muscle it leg-side. Top-edges it and Roach got under the ball quite early. A tired shot, but Kohli walks back to a big round of applause

dismissalText.commentary: Shreyas Iyer b Holder 71 (68b 5x4 1x6 101m) SR: 104.41

dismissalComment.html: leg stump gone! Full, on middle, and Iyer had walked across the stumps - exposing two wickets. Can't connect with the flick either, and his stumps are rattled. A solid innings comes to an end, a strong case for Iyer to continue being India's No. 4

headshotImage.caption: Rishabh Pant player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rishabh Pant player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: hits the top of off! Something like 12 dot balls for Pant in his last 14 balls, and it has elicited a dismal whip across the line. Superbly engineered by West Indies. Kept bowling at his body, forcing him to push around, and when the runs dried up, they played on his inexperience - a slower ball from Brathwaite. Cutting away from middle. He wants to scoop towards fine leg but it is the wrong option. Yet another soft end to a Pant innings

headshotImage.caption: Roston Chase player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Roston Chase player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: taken at point! A misguided hoick from Rohit. Another tossed up ball, nice and slow outside off. Not much drift or revs on it, just a proper lack of pace. Dips on him as he steps out and then grips in the pitch. Gets some extra bounce as a result and Rohit's attempted slog into the leg side ends up in a one-handed losing of shape. Leading edge and Pooran runs back to hold on smartly

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan lbw b Cottrell 2 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: big appeal but the umpire is disinterested. Full, on off, and Dhawan had prodded forward to defend, but the ball hit his pads. Conference between the WI players and Holder goes for a review! Definitely looked like an inside edge on first glance, but what do the replays show? Oooooh, it looks like front pad-back pad, and no bat involved. Impact in front of off stump, and that is smashing into middle stump. Epic review - Dhawan goes!

dismissalText.commentary: Evin Lewis c Kohli b Kuldeep Yadav 65 (80b 8x4 1x6 128m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: one-handed catch! And Kohli asks *someone* to shut up by putting his finger to his lips. Just not sure who... This was a short and wide ball, that was turning further away, and Lewis toe-ended a cut. Kohli timed his jump to perfection by sticking his right hand over his head. Big, big wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Nicholas Pooran c Kohli b Kumar 42 (52b 4x4 1x6 69m) SR: 80.76

dismissalComment.html: taken at midwicket! Oh he was looking scratchy the last 20 minutes. Bhuvneshwar comes back and gets him. That might be a shorter knuckle ball. Middle stump line. Jumps into the leg side and looks for the pull. Slices it up and Kohli is there

Gayle has reviewed an lbw decision. That was full and on middle stump. Sounded like an inside edge, but Gayle took some time to think about it, so that's out of the question I suppose. He's struck right in front of middle...is it pitching in line? Just. The decision will stand. And the review is gone. As is Gayle. Bhuvneshwar strikes. India wanted Shami to bowl this over, but he'd been off the field for a bit and wasn't back in time to come straight on. Inadvertently, it has worked. Full ball pitching on leg, skidding on and rapping him. He was just hanging the bat out without a stride

dismissalComment.html: plucks that out of the air, horizontal to his left! Wow! Bhuvneshwar Kumar! Flipped the game in five minutes. Length ball at off and middle. He wants to turn this into the leg side, but it sticks in the pitch. And it floats back off the shoulder of his bat. It's very far to the bowler's left, but he's managed to steady himself and go full stretch, one-handed. And he's held on. Back up quickly with a sheepish grin. Superb.

dismissalText.commentary: Shai Hope b Ahmed 5 (10b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: chops it on! Short of a length and rising up and away from the corridor. Looks to punch it through cover and the closed face has resulted in an inside edge. We saw the Indian batsmen struggling to hit through the line earlier. That's because the ball has been gripping all day. And it does so again, he's through the shot too early and is not in particularly good shape for the punch by the end og it all

dismissalText.commentary: Carlos Brathwaite c Mohammed Shami b Jadeja 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: taken at short third. Self-destruct, activate. India have found 10 minutes resembling an opening, and they've used it to get all over West Indies. Length at off stump, Brathwaite with a frenzied swing across the line, without getting to the pitch. That's Jadeja's angle making him go leg side. But Jadeja has also got this to grip and spin away. Leading edge is held with no fuss

commentPostTextItems.html: 6:32pm And that is all! Thank you for joining us. See you soon.

Kohli: Good outing with the bat. Exactly why we wanted to bat first if you saw the latter half of West Indies' innings. I think the rain helped them in the middle, otherwise it would have been even tougher to bat.

[Middle overs] It was important to string as many dot balls as possible. The ball got really wet every time it went out into the outfield. It was difficult to grip. We thought it was a tricky situation if we didn't get wickets there. It was just about staying there, getting one wicket and put pressure.

Kuldeep [is getting into the XI] purely because of the number of left handers. It tempts you to go with the chinaman more than the legspinner and with Jadeja is gives us more depth with the bat as well.
Shreyas is a confident guy, he's got the right attitude. Good hands. He made it easier for me.
Virat Kohli is the Man of the Match.

Holder: Extremely disappointed. We had the game in our hand. We bowled well to come back in the end. The wickets in the end really cost us. We've got to take responsibility. One of the main things is when you get in, you've got to go deep. I must commend the bowlers. It was very hot and humid, tough conditions to bowl. We've definitely got to take responsibility and ownership as batters.

6:13pm Yet again, for West Indies. We've seen that expression on Holder's face before. Not long ago, the required rate was just above six an over and they had wickets in hand. And then, inside two overs, everything turned. Bhuvneshwar with Pooran's wicket, and then a stunning catch to remove Chase. Induced a false shot from Brathwaite the next over too, and that was where it was all given away. India were feeling it a little - overthrows, misfields, angry captain. Because West Indies were in it for a long time. But they've pulled through, and it's another impressive win for them.

commentTextItems.html: low full toss, dipping in at off stump. Driven to long-off

commentPostTextItems.html: Mark: "Getting just a bit one-sided." --- You might be onto something.

commentTextItems.html: full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep square

clears mid-off. Slower ball at a length outside off, backs away and carves it over the fielder

and again. Looks a length ball there for a smiting, but it just doesn't get up off the pitch. Skids through
lovely slower ball. Floats up and dips under the bat as it curves away from off stump. Holder's eyes had lit up as he swung at this
short and wide. Looks to cut, beaten

short and outside off. Stabbed to point's right

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c Pooran b Chase 18 (34b 2x4 0x6 75m) SR: 52.94

dismissalComment.html: taken at point! A misguided hoick from Rohit. Another tossed up ball, nice and slow outside off. Not much drift or revs on it, just a proper lack of pace. Dips on him as he steps out and then grips in the pitch. Gets some extra bounce as a result and Rohit's attempted slog into the leg side ends up in a one-handed losing of shape. Leading edge and Pooran runs back to hold on smartly

image.longCaption: Kemar Roach player portrait, West Indies media day

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli c Roach b Brathwaite 120 (125b 14x4 1x6 179m) SR: 96

dismissalComment.html: it's a skyer and Roach makes no mistake at long off. The fielder went deep just before this delivery. Slower ball, not full enough, and Kohli tries to muscle it leg-side. Top-edges it and Roach got under the ball quite early. A tired shot, but Kohli walks back to a big round of applause

headshotImage.longCaption: Carlos Brathwaite player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rishabh Pant b Brathwaite 20 (35b 2x4 0x6 27m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: hits the top of off! Something like 12 dot balls for Pant in his last 14 balls, and it has elicited a dismal whip across the line. Superbly engineered by West Indies. Kept bowling at his body, forcing him to push around, and when the runs dried up, they played on his inexperience - a slower ball from Brathwaite. Cutting away from middle. He wants to scoop towards fine leg but it is the wrong option. Yet another soft end to a Pant innings

dismissalText.commentary: Shreyas Iyer b Holder 71 (68b 5x4 1x6 101m) SR: 104.41

dismissalComment.html: leg stump gone! Full, on middle, and Iyer had walked across the stumps - exposing two wickets. Can't connect with the flick either, and his stumps are rattled. A solid innings comes to an end, a strong case for Iyer to continue being India's No. 4

dismissalComment.html: big appeal but the umpire is disinterested. Full, on off, and Dhawan had prodded forward to defend, but the ball hit his pads. Conference between the WI players and Holder goes for a review! Definitely looked like an inside edge on first glance, but what do the replays show? Oooooh, it looks like front pad-back pad, and no bat involved. Impact in front of off stump, and that is smashing into middle stump. Epic review - Dhawan goes!

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle lbw b Kumar 11 (24b 1x4 0x6 49m) SR: 45.83

dismissalComment.html: Gayle has reviewed an lbw decision. That was full and on middle stump. Sounded like an inside edge, but Gayle took some time to think about it, so that's out of the question I suppose. He's struck right in front of middle...is it pitching in line? Just. The decision will stand. And the review is gone. As is Gayle. Bhuvneshwar strikes. India wanted Shami to bowl this over, but he'd been off the field for a bit and wasn't back in time to come straight on. Inadvertently, it has worked. Full ball pitching on leg, skidding on and rapping him. He was just hanging the bat out without a stride

dismissalText.commentary: Evin Lewis c Kohli b Kuldeep Yadav 65 (80b 8x4 1x6 128m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: one-handed catch! And Kohli asks *someone* to shut up by putting his finger to his lips. Just not sure who... This was a short and wide ball, that was turning further away, and Lewis toe-ended a cut. Kohli timed his jump to perfection by sticking his right hand over his head. Big, big wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Shai Hope b Ahmed 5 (10b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: chops it on! Short of a length and rising up and away from the corridor. Looks to punch it through cover and the closed face has resulted in an inside edge. We saw the Indian batsmen struggling to hit through the line earlier. That's because the ball has been gripping all day. And it does so again, he's through the shot too early and is not in particularly good shape for the punch by the end og it all

dismissalText.commentary: Roston Chase c & b Kumar 18 (23b 0x4 0x6 34m) SR: 78.26

dismissalComment.html: plucks that out of the air, horizontal to his left! Wow! Bhuvneshwar Kumar! Flipped the game in five minutes. Length ball at off and middle. He wants to turn this into the leg side, but it sticks in the pitch. And it floats back off the shoulder of his bat. It's very far to the bowler's left, but he's managed to steady himself and go full stretch, one-handed. And he's held on. Back up quickly with a sheepish grin. Superb.

dismissalText.commentary: Jason Holder not out 13 (19b 0x4 0x6 38m) SR: 68.42

dismissalText.commentary: Carlos Brathwaite c Mohammed Shami b Jadeja 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: taken at short third. Self-destruct, activate. India have found 10 minutes resembling an opening, and they've used it to get all over West Indies. Length at off stump, Brathwaite with a frenzied swing across the line, without getting to the pitch. That's Jadeja's angle making him go leg side. But Jadeja has also got this to grip and spin away. Leading edge is held with no fuss

dismissalText.commentary: Sheldon Cottrell c Jadeja b Mohammed Shami 17 (18b 2x4 1x6 23m) SR: 94.44

dismissalComment.html: holds on! Jadeja running backwards from backward point, towards third man, who is also sprinting in. Short ball in the corridor, looks to pull and slices it. Jadeja keeps his eyes on it looking over his shoulder. Fumbles after getting his hands on it, but holds on

dismissalComment.html: Gayle has reviewed an lbw decision. That was full and on middle stump. Sounded like an inside edge, but Gayle took some time to think about it, so that's out of the question I suppose. He's struck right in front of middle...is it pitching in line? Just. The decision will stand. And the review is gone. As is Gayle. Bhuvneshwar strikes. India wanted Shami to bowl this over, but he'd been off the field for a bit and wasn't back in time to come straight on. Inadvertently, it has worked. Full ball pitching on leg, skidding on and rapping him. He was just hanging the bat out without a stride

dismissalText.commentary: Shai Hope b Ahmed 5 (10b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: chops it on! Short of a length and rising up and away from the corridor. Looks to punch it through cover and the closed face has resulted in an inside edge. We saw the Indian batsmen struggling to hit through the line earlier. That's because the ball has been gripping all day. And it does so again, he's through the shot too early and is not in particularly good shape for the punch by the end og it all

dismissalText.commentary: Shimron Hetmyer c Kohli b Kuldeep Yadav 18 (20b 2x4 0x6 31m) SR: 90

dismissalComment.html: sliced and Kohli - his RCB captain - calls for the catch. Taken at short cover. This was a half-tracker on middle, and Hetmyer tried to pull this over cow corner, but the ball went the other direction. A disappointed Hetty walks back in super-slow-mo

dismissalText.commentary: Evin Lewis c Kohli b Kuldeep Yadav 65 (80b 8x4 1x6 128m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: one-handed catch! And Kohli asks *someone* to shut up by putting his finger to his lips. Just not sure who... This was a short and wide ball, that was turning further away, and Lewis toe-ended a cut. Kohli timed his jump to perfection by sticking his right hand over his head. Big, big wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Nicholas Pooran c Kohli b Kumar 42 (52b 4x4 1x6 69m) SR: 80.76

dismissalComment.html: taken at midwicket! Oh he was looking scratchy the last 20 minutes. Bhuvneshwar comes back and gets him. That might be a shorter knuckle ball. Middle stump line. Jumps into the leg side and looks for the pull. Slices it up and Kohli is there

headshotImage.longCaption: Roston Chase player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Roston Chase c & b Kumar 18 (23b 0x4 0x6 34m) SR: 78.26

dismissalComment.html: plucks that out of the air, horizontal to his left! Wow! Bhuvneshwar Kumar! Flipped the game in five minutes. Length ball at off and middle. He wants to turn this into the leg side, but it sticks in the pitch. And it floats back off the shoulder of his bat. It's very far to the bowler's left, but he's managed to steady himself and go full stretch, one-handed. And he's held on. Back up quickly with a sheepish grin. Superb.

dismissalText.commentary: Carlos Brathwaite c Mohammed Shami b Jadeja 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: taken at short third. Self-destruct, activate. India have found 10 minutes resembling an opening, and they've used it to get all over West Indies. Length at off stump, Brathwaite with a frenzied swing across the line, without getting to the pitch. That's Jadeja's angle making him go leg side. But Jadeja has also got this to grip and spin away. Leading edge is held with no fuss

dismissalText.commentary: Kemar Roach b Kumar 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: chopped on. Length ball just outside off. Roach shuffles across and looks to poke into the off side. Inside edge onto the stumps. Wasn't behind the line. That doesn't help

dismissalText.commentary: Sheldon Cottrell c Jadeja b Mohammed Shami 17 (18b 2x4 1x6 23m) SR: 94.44

dismissalComment.html: holds on! Jadeja running backwards from backward point, towards third man, who is also sprinting in. Short ball in the corridor, looks to pull and slices it. Jadeja keeps his eyes on it looking over his shoulder. Fumbles after getting his hands on it, but holds on

dismissalText.commentary: Oshane Thomas lbw b Mohammed Shami 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: given! Shami goes around the wicket, fires it in at middle stump. Oshane looks to block and is trapped right in front of the stumps. Was there bat on it? Hard to tell. No review though. That is that
